content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is an example of how you could write this function in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all code blocks
    code_blocks = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```", md, 1))
    
    # Remove code fences and join the code blocks together with a newline
    joined_code = join([replace(block, "`" => "") for block in code_blocks], "\n")
    
    return joined_code
end
```
This function uses regular expressions to find all occurrences of Julia-formatted code blocks in the input string `md`. It then removes the code fence characters and joins the resulting strings together with a newline character. 

Please note that this function assumes that the code blocks are correctly formatted as per the markdown standard, i.e., they start with ```julia\n and end with \n``` to denote the end of the block. If there is any possibility of incorrect formatting in your input string, you may need to add additional error checking or handling.
